summary: This is an email chain from October 5, 2021, regarding a follow-up request for victim application forms related to the Maxwell case. An FBI Victim Specialist in New York clarifies they do not possess the forms, which are handled by the Office for Victim Services (OVS), and were only a conduit. An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York had requested forms for six individuals.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is requesting victim application forms for six individuals in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Email exchange regarding the handling of victim application forms in the Maxwell case, with the FBI specialist responding to the prosecutor's request.

events.title: Email request for victim forms
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests victim application forms for six individuals in the Maxwell case, and an FBI Victim Specialist clarifies the forms are with the Office for Victim Services.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: An FBI Victim Specialist states they do not possess victim application forms for the Maxwell case; those forms are with the Office for Victim Services (OVS).
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested forms for six individuals, indicating ongoing victim-related proceedings in the Maxwell case.
The email highlights the procedural role of the FBI as a middleman in providing victim forms to OVS, not as the record keeper.
